channel.description: Latest other threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Apex Legends 'Remote Control' Hack Patched After Streamers Hijacked
item.description:
Respawn Entertainment, the developer of the popular battle royale game Apex Legends, rapidly deployed a patch on January 10, 2026, to fix a significant security exploit. The vulnerability allowed a malicious actor to remotely take control of other players' characters during a live match, an incident...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Other

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical Flaw in GNU Wget2 Allows Arbitrary File Overwrites
item.description:
A critical vulnerability, CVE-2025-69194, has been discovered in GNU Wget2, the modern replacement for the ubiquitous Wget file download utility. The flaw is an improper path validation issue (path traversal) that can be triggered by a malicious remote server. An attacker can trick a vulnerable Wget...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Other

Read Full Article →

item.title: A Look Inside the CVE Process: The Story of a Rejected ID
item.description:
On January 3, 2026, the National Vulnerability Database (NVD) officially updated the status of CVE-2025-34775 to 'REJECTED'. This status indicates that while the identifier was reserved by a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA), it was ultimately not used for a public vulnerability disclosure. This can occ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Other, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Baker University Discloses Year-Old Breach Affecting Over 53,000 Individuals
item.description:
Baker University in Kansas has begun notifying 53,624 individuals about a severe data breach that occurred in December 2024. Attackers maintained access to the university's network for over two weeks, from December 2 to December 19, 2024. The compromised data is highly sensitive, including names, So...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Incident Response, Other

Read Full Article →

item.title: CEO of Chinese Cybersecurity Firm Cnzxsoft Hit with Spending Ban Amid Debt Crisis
item.description:
On December 22, 2025, veteran Chinese cybersecurity firm Cnzxsoft (Zhongxin Network Information Security Co., Ltd.) was placed on a Beijing court's list of "dishonest judgment debtors" due to a severe liquidity crisis. As a result, the company's founder and CEO, Zhou Xiandong, was issued a Restricte...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Other, Policy and Compliance

item.title: Eswatini Faces Cybersecurity Crisis as Government Fails to Act on Rising Threats
item.description:
A report published on December 13, 2025, reveals a deepening cybersecurity crisis in the Kingdom of Eswatini. The nation is experiencing a significant increase in cyberattacks targeting citizens, businesses, and government bodies. This surge is compounded by a lack of effective government response, ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Other

item.title: Mexico's Maguen Group Launches Global Cybersecurity Brand 'Fortem'
item.description:
Maguen Group, a leading private security firm based in Mexico, has officially launched Fortem Cybersecurity, its new global cybersecurity brand, on December 7, 2025. The new entity is an evolution of the company's existing cybersecurity arm, MT Cyber, which it acquired in 2019. With Fortem, Maguen G...

Categories: Other

item.title: AI Cybersecurity Firm Tenex Expands to EMEA with New Funding
item.description:
AI-native cybersecurity firm Tenex announced its expansion into the Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) region on December 2, 2025. The strategic move is supported by a new Series A investment from the global investment firm DTCP. Tenex, which offers an AI-driven managed detection and response (M...

item.title: CrowdStrike Named AWS Global Security and Marketplace Partner of the Year
item.description:
At the AWS re:Invent 2025 conference, cybersecurity leader CrowdStrike was named both the Amazon Web Services (AWS) 2025 Global Security Partner of the Year and the Global Marketplace Partner of the Year. This dual recognition follows a landmark achievement for CrowdStrike, which became the first cl...

item.title: Global Infrastructure Breach Alert Confirmed as False Alarm
item.description:
Initial reports on November 30, 2025, of a major security breach impacting global infrastructure were officially confirmed to be a false alarm. The panic was triggered when automated monitoring tools misinterpreted routine, benign system tests as a sophisticated cyberattack, leading to a cascade of ...

Severity: Informational
